Description: Marble memorial to a soldier named Ares, who died aged 29. The two figures may represent Ares or two individuals called Ares (possibly father and son).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Alexandria (Egypt), military necropolis of Nikopolis (probably from)
Curator's comments: Marble from Asia Minor. Probbably found in Alexandria. See Lajtar 2002 on date. For latest discussion see: Waebens, S. 2012. Ares: Brother, Commander, Deity or Son? A New Interpretation of the Ares Tombstone, Chronique d'Égypte 87/174, 322-339 A. CHANIOTIS e.a. (eds.), 2005. in: SEG LII (2002), 608-609 no. 1762; AE, 567 no. 1609. J. BINGEN, 2002. ‘Bulletin épigraphique’, REG 116 (2003), 675-676 no. 615; AE, 601-602 no. 1586; A. LAJTAR, 2002. ‘A Tombstone for the Soldier Ares (Egypt, Late Antonine Period)’, JJP 32, 45-48; K. PARLASCA, in: K. PARLASCA & H. SEEMANN, 1999. Augenblicke. Mumienporträts und ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit, Frankfurt, 254-255 no. 159; O. STOLL, 2005. ‘«Quod miles vovit…» oder: Der doppelte Ares. Bemerkungen zur Grabstele eines Veteranen aus Alexandria’, AKB 35, 65-76;
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (2271)
Inscription / The Collection of Ancient Greek Inscriptions in the British Museum (1113)
